Docs.summary: Describes the placement of where a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup"> control appears on the screen.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the members of this enumeration class to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.Placement%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.Placement%2A> property value, together with the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PlacementTarget%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.PlacementRectangle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.HorizontalOffset%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup.VerticalOffset%2A>properties, determines where and how a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> appears on the screen. For more information, see [Popup Placement Behavior](../Topic/Popup%20Placement%20Behavior.md).
## Examples The following example creates four <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> controls that are relative to an image. Each <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup> has a different value for the placement property.
